alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Greene; Oconee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 05 at 10:23AM EST until February 07 at 2:05AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Penfield affecting Greene, Oconee and Clarke Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Penfield. * WHEN...From this evening to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding occurs along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the Georgia Highway 15 bridge. The right bank begins to overflow into agricultural land and pastures with a foot or two of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Saturday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 13.7 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 13 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
